name: sundog
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a bright spot that appears in the sky on either side of the sun, caused by the refraction (= bending) of light through ice crystals in high cloud: Many displays, such as rainbows and sundogs, are caused by ice crystals or water vapour. The icy sky had produced a wonderful show of sun dogs.
/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examples Sundogs are caused by sunlight passing through flat, six-sided ice crystals high in the troposphere. Northern lights filled the sky at night, sun dogs during the bitter days. She often points out things in the sky - phenomena such as sundogs, halos, and unusual cloud shapes.
